items.title: Trump speaks after last living hostages returned to Israel from Gaza
items.standfirst: President Trump addresses Israeli lawmakers after Hamas handed over the final 13 living hostages under the Gaza peace deal brokered by the U.S. leader.
items.content: President Trump addresses Israeli lawmakers after Hamas handed over the final 13 living hostages under the Gaza peace deal brokered by the U.S. leader.

items.title: Buses carrying Palestinian prisoners freed under Gaza truce deal arrive in Ramallah
items.standfirst: Families eagerly awaited reunification as buses carrying dozens of freed Palestinian prisoners arrived in Ramallah and Gaza. Israel began releasing over 1,900 prisoners and detainees as part of the ceasefire agreement. Cheering crowds greeted the buses arriving in Ramallah from Ofer prison in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, while at least one bus crossed into the Gaza Strip, according to the Hamas-run Prisoners Office. FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports from Ramallah, West Bank.
items.content: Families eagerly awaited reunification as buses carrying dozens of freed Palestinian prisoners arrived in Ramallah and Gaza. Israel began releasing over 1,900 prisoners and detainees as part of the ceasefire agreement. Cheering crowds greeted the buses arriving in Ramallah from Ofer prison in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, while at least one bus crossed into the Gaza Strip, according to the Hamas-run Prisoners Office. FRANCE 24's Claire Paccalin reports from Ramallah, West Bank.

items.title: Israeli hostages come home amid Gaza ceasefire deal
items.standfirst: Hamas released 20 Israeli hostages on Monday October 13, as part of a ceasefire deal, with emotional reunions and celebrations across Israel. The exchange, coordinated with the Red Cross, also includes the return of 28 deceased hostages in exchange for nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees.
items.content: Hamas released 20 Israeli hostages on Monday October 13, as part of a ceasefire deal, with emotional reunions and celebrations across Israel. The exchange, coordinated with the Red Cross, also includes the return of 28 deceased hostages in exchange for nearly 2,000 Palestinian detainees.

items.title: Hamas releases all 20 remaining living hostages as part of Gaza ceasefire
Donald Trump celebrated in Israel for his role in hostage release
items.standfirst: As he heads to Israel, US President Donald Trump is set to receive a hero’s welcome, praised for his role in brokering a ceasefire and securing the release of Israeli hostages. Celebrated in the Israeli press and even impersonated by actors in Tel Aviv’s Hostage Square, Trump has drawn comparisons to biblical figures and been warmly thanked by hostage families.
items.content: As he heads to Israel, US President Donald Trump is set to receive a hero’s welcome, praised for his role in brokering a ceasefire and securing the release of Israeli hostages. Celebrated in the Israeli press and even impersonated by actors in Tel Aviv’s Hostage Square, Trump has drawn comparisons to biblical figures and been warmly thanked by hostage families.

Hamas Frees Israeli Hostages in First Step of Ceasefire Deal
Aid trucks trickle into Gaza
items.standfirst: Some aid trucks have crossed into Gaza, as a ceasefire with Israel holds for a third day. In shocking scenes, shipments were ransacked by starving residents. Israel says it expects all living hostages held in the Gaza Strip to be released Monday, confirming the next phase of the breakthrough ceasefire deal with Hamas.
items.content: Some aid trucks have crossed into Gaza, as a ceasefire with Israel holds for a third day. In shocking scenes, shipments were ransacked by starving residents. Israel says it expects all living hostages held in the Gaza Strip to be released Monday, confirming the next phase of the breakthrough ceasefire deal with Hamas.

items.title: Hamas releases Israeli hostages
items.standfirst: Israelis on Monday celebrated the return of the last surviving hostages from Gaza, a defining exchange in the fragile ceasefire that has paused two years of war between Israel and Hamas. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky is in Tel Aviv to cover the story.

items.title: Trump as saviour of Israel vs. The west’s immoral hypocrisy: Papers analyse Gaza deal
items.standfirst: PRESS REVIEW – Monday, October 13: Israeli papers, from right-wing to left-wing, have praised US President Donald Trump following the hostage release. Meanwhile, the Arab press highlights the West’s “outrageous” treatment of Palestinians. Finally, The New York Times describes the peace deal as a “defeat” for Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu.
items.content: PRESS REVIEW – Monday, October 13: Israeli papers, from right-wing to left-wing, have praised US President Donald Trump following the hostage release. Meanwhile, the Arab press highlights the West’s “outrageous” treatment of Palestinians. Finally, The New York Times describes the peace deal as a “defeat” for Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu.

items.title: Israel: Thousands celebrate hostages’ return in Tel Aviv’s Hostages Square
items.standfirst: Thousands gathered in Tel Aviv’s Hostages Square to celebrate the release of 20 Israeli hostages freed under a ceasefire deal brokered by President Trump. The crowd erupted in joy and tears, honoring those who returned while remembering those who did not. FRANCE 24's correspondent describes the atmosphere as bittersweet—overflowing with joy for the hostages’ return but shadowed by the grief for those who were lost.
items.content: Thousands gathered in Tel Aviv’s Hostages Square to celebrate the release of 20 Israeli hostages freed under a ceasefire deal brokered by President Trump. The crowd erupted in joy and tears, honoring those who returned while remembering those who did not. FRANCE 24's correspondent describes the atmosphere as bittersweet—overflowing with joy for the hostages’ return but shadowed by the grief for those who were lost.

items.title: Hamas releases 20 remaining living Israeli hostages after two years in Gaza
items.standfirst: Group handed over to Red Cross as Israeli ministers approve list of more than 1,700 Palestinians for releaseGaza ceasefire – live updatesAll 20 remaining living Israeli hostages have been released by Hamas after more than two years in captivity in Gaza.Parents were reunited with sons and children with fathers as those held were handed over to the Red Cross before finally rejoining their families with the help of the Israeli army. Even before their release, Hamas had allowed some of the hostages to make video calls home on Monday morning. Continue reading...
items.content: Group handed over to Red Cross as Israeli ministers approve list of more than 1,700 Palestinians for releaseGaza ceasefire – live updatesAll 20 remaining living Israeli hostages have been released by Hamas after more than two years in captivity in Gaza.Parents were reunited with sons and children with fathers as those held were handed over to the Red Cross before finally rejoining their families with the help of the Israeli army. Even before their release, Hamas had allowed some of the hostages to make video calls home on Monday morning. Continue reading...

items.title: Donald Trump arrives in Israel as hostages return
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump arrived in Israel on Monday to celebrate the U.S.-brokered ceasefire and hostage deal between Israel and Hamas, an agreement that he declared had effectively ended the war and opened the door to building a durable peace in the Middle East. The US leader was whisked off to the Knesset, where he's scheduled to speak to Israeli lawmakers. After arriving, he signed the guest book. FRANCE 24's Shirli Sitbon has the analysis.
items.content: President Donald Trump arrived in Israel on Monday to celebrate the U.S.-brokered ceasefire and hostage deal between Israel and Hamas, an agreement that he declared had effectively ended the war and opened the door to building a durable peace in the Middle East. The US leader was whisked off to the Knesset, where he's scheduled to speak to Israeli lawmakers. After arriving, he signed the guest book. FRANCE 24's Shirli Sitbon has the analysis.

items.title: Israel expects all 20 living hostages to be freed from Gaza on Monday morning
items.standfirst: Government says it is also preparing for release of 2,000 Palestinian detainees in crucial next phase of ceasefire dealGaza ceasefire live: follow all the latest updatesThe Israeli government says it expects all living hostages held in Gaza to be released on Monday morning and that it is preparing for the release of about 2,000 Palestinian detainees, the crucial next phase of the ceasefire deal that could end the two-year war in Gaza.“We are expecting all 20 of our living hostages to be released together at one time to the Red Cross and transported among six to eight vehicles,” said the Israeli government spokesperson Shosh Bedrosian. Continue reading...

items.title: Netherlands invoke rare emergency law to take charge of Chinese chipmaker
items.standfirst: The Dutch government has taken temporary control of Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia under emergency legislation, citing risks to national and European security and marking one of the most forceful state interventions in Europe’s tech sector to date.
items.content: The Dutch government has taken temporary control of Chinese-owned chipmaker Nexperia under emergency legislation, citing risks to national and European security and marking one of the most forceful state interventions in Europe’s tech sector to date.

items.content: An elite military unit that installed the president in 2009 has joined Gen Z protesters calling for his resignation.

items.title: Madagascar’s president says illegal power grab by military is under way
items.standfirst: Soldiers from elite Capsat unit have announced they are taking over after weeks of youth-led protestsMadagascar’s president said an “attempt to seize power illegally and by force” was under way, as an elite military unit that joined protesters on the streets on Saturday announced it was taking over the army.The Capsat unit’s intervention comes after weeks of youth-led protests, which started on 25 September against water and electricity shortages and expanded to calling for the resignation of the president, Andry Rajoelina, an end to corruption and radical overhaul of the political system. Continue reading...
items.content: Soldiers from elite Capsat unit have announced they are taking over after weeks of youth-led protestsMadagascar’s president said an “attempt to seize power illegally and by force” was under way, as an elite military unit that joined protesters on the streets on Saturday announced it was taking over the army.The Capsat unit’s intervention comes after weeks of youth-led protests, which started on 25 September against water and electricity shortages and expanded to calling for the resignation of the president, Andry Rajoelina, an end to corruption and radical overhaul of the political system. Continue reading...

items.title: Soldiers from elite Capsat unit join protests against Madagascar’s president
items.standfirst: Demonstrators march alongside regiment, who earlier in the day said they would not fire on the crowdsMadagascar’s prime minister called for calm after an elite group of soldiers joined thousands of protesters against the country’s president on the streets of the capital on Saturday afternoon.Protesters marched alongside soldiers from the Capsat unit, who drove armoured vehicles, some waving Madagascar flags, from their base in Soanierana in the south of Antananarivo. Continue reading...
items.content: Demonstrators march alongside regiment, who earlier in the day said they would not fire on the crowdsMadagascar’s prime minister called for calm after an elite group of soldiers joined thousands of protesters against the country’s president on the streets of the capital on Saturday afternoon.Protesters marched alongside soldiers from the Capsat unit, who drove armoured vehicles, some waving Madagascar flags, from their base in Soanierana in the south of Antananarivo. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The president of Madagascar claimed a coup was underway.
An elite military unit joined youth-led protests.
Protests began against water and electricity shortages.
Protesters expanded demands to include the president's resignation.
Soldiers from the Capsat unit announced they were taking over the army.

items.title: Economics Nobel Prize awarded for explaining ‘innovation-driven’ growth
items.standfirst: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt share prestigious award
items.content: Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt share prestigious award

items.title: Mokyr, Aghion and Howitt win Nobel Prize in economics for work on innovation-driven growth
items.standfirst: The Nobel memorial prize in economics was on Monday awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt for “having explained innovation-driven economic growth". The winners were credited with better quantifying “creative destruction,” a key concept in economics that refers to the process in which beneficial new innovations replace – and thus destroy – older technologies and businesses.
items.content: The Nobel memorial prize in economics was on Monday awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt for “having explained innovation-driven economic growth". The winners were credited with better quantifying “creative destruction,” a key concept in economics that refers to the process in which beneficial new innovations replace – and thus destroy – older technologies and businesses.

items.title: Tencent is investing in shooting games, traditionally dominated by Western companies, after the 2024 success of Delta Force, which still has 30M players daily
Tencent’s ‘Delta Force’ Success Shifts Focus to Shooting Games
items.standfirst: For more than a decade, Tencent Holdings Ltd. developer Leo Yao toiled in relative anonymity, churning out one shooting game after another. Then he scored one of the biggest Chinese hits of 2024 with Delta Force, a game that continues to attract 30 million players daily.
items.content: For more than a decade, Tencent Holdings Ltd. developer Leo Yao toiled in relative anonymity, churning out one shooting game after another. Then he scored one of the biggest Chinese hits of 2024 with Delta Force, a game that continues to attract 30 million players daily.

items.standfirst: China Renaissance Holdings Ltd., the Beijing-based Chinese investment bank whose former chairman Bao Fan was released from detention in August, is in talks to raise about $600 million for a public vehicle that would invest in a cryptocurrency with close ties to Binance Holdings Ltd.

clusters.title: Live: Macron ignores calls to resign as reinstated French PM’s new govt takes office
clusters.neutral_headline: Live: Macron ignores calls to resign as reinstated French PM’s new govt takes office

items.title: Live: Macron ignores calls to resign as reinstated French PM’s new govt takes office
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron said Monday he would continue to serve to ensure stability in the country, ignoring repeated calls by the opposition for him to resign amid France's worst political crisis in decades. Macron spoke as reinstated Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s new government takes office amid mounting pressure to urgently produce a budget and quell political turmoil that is scaring businesses and investors. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron said Monday he would continue to serve to ensure stability in the country, ignoring repeated calls by the opposition for him to resign amid France's worst political crisis in decades. Macron spoke as reinstated Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu’s new government takes office amid mounting pressure to urgently produce a budget and quell political turmoil that is scaring businesses and investors. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.

items.title: French PM Lecornu names new government before looming budget deadline
items.standfirst: Reinstated French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu named a new government Sunday after a meeting with President Emmanuel Macron, as he faces pressure to urgently produce a budget and quell the political turmoil engulfing France. It is unclear how long this new team, which includes several old faces and some new, will last.
items.content: Reinstated French Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu named a new government Sunday after a meeting with President Emmanuel Macron, as he faces pressure to urgently produce a budget and quell the political turmoil engulfing France. It is unclear how long this new team, which includes several old faces and some new, will last.

items.title: France’s Macron unveils new government ahead of budget deadline
items.standfirst: The new government, led by Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu, must present a 2026 draft budget on Monday.
items.content: The new government, led by Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu, must present a 2026 draft budget on Monday.

ai_summary: French President Macron is ignoring calls to resign.
Reinstated Prime Minister Lecornu named a new government.
The new government faces a budget deadline.
The new government must present a 2026 draft budget.
